newsitem.title: KENYA: Coffee prices fall by up to $5 at Kenya auction.
newsitem.headline: Coffee prices fall by up to $5 at Kenya auction.

text.p: Coffee prices were lower at the weekly Kenyan export auction on Tuesday, declining by as much as $5, traders and auction officials said.

A senior official from Kenya Coffee Auctions, a subsidiary of the Coffee Board of Kenya, said AAs averaged $138.50 per 50-kg bag from $140.5 last week, grade ABs eased to $132 from $138 while Cs fell to $129 from $133.

"On a slow market the prices declined by some $5," the auction official said. The Coffee Board said it sold all 40,698 60-kg bags it offered for sale versus 40,591 sold last week. --Nairobi newsroom +254-2 330-261.
